comments.body: Just place blocks on lily pads.
And make long boats with banner sails.
And rafts will be crafted with bamboo blocks instead of bamboo planks.

I think this has some serious potential. The ability to make a personal base out on the open water. However, minecraft is all about exploring and mining. To keep with the gamnes original mechanics, may i make the following suggestions as add ons to your idea.

 1- You have a limited number of bamboo rafts that can be connected. Say.... 20-25? So you have a small base out on the ocean. 

2- Drowned and other hostile ocean mobs can destroy your rafts after say, 6 hits.

Every 2 hits degrades the raft and it visually shows like when you break a block. NOW, you can repair the raft base with bamboo. But since there's so much bamboo, I would suggest you need to have 4 blocks of bamboo (not sticks) to repair one hit on the raft base.

So you need 9 bamboo sticks to make 1 block, 4 blocks to heal one hit, so you need 108 bamboo total for 12 blocks to repair a whole raft for your raft base. That's not too hard since you get so much bamboo. It also still encourages the player to have a small to decent sized land base as a back up or farm, thus still encouraging you to explore the land and underground keepign with the essence of the game.

3- The raft base also needs some sort of anchor (perhaps made out of copper? To give copper more uses?) or else it WILL drift away. But you cannot steer or move the base once you have connected more than 2 rafts together.

4- There should also be some sort of smaller block that shows the raft parts are connected so you can destroy it to seperate rafts.

I feel like the only one that (probably) isn't already the idea is the dangerous plant one lmao -- idk if a dangerous plant would be great, unless it was an actual mob, but then why would you need a sniffer? Sniffers are pretty rare from what I understand, so it'd be kinda annoying if they were the only way to rid of them. If the rest isn't already apart of the sniffer though, I agree!! That'd be super cool if you could get random stuff and bones from the sniffers, and the plants should have uses like food or potion ingredients while still being super cool. Also, I don't mean to turn this into a debate but imo, I feel like the tuff golems were the worst, I see your point, but while it gives the block a use (I use them for building over lava, so personally, there is a use for them) the mob does nothing. At least with the sniffer we get new things, I bet the rascal would have given more enchantments, but I love plants (maybe I just have bias then LOL) -- but the other guy is right, we don't know much about them yet lol
I find that most people are usually dissatisfied with whichever mob wins the vote.
Sniffers add decor and are unextinct. Tuff golems are (occasionally) walking item frames. Rascals give you crappy treasure for walking around a mine.

I think you need to remember that not all features in Minecraft must appeal to every demographic of Minecraft players. Updates, yes, but not individual features.

Sniffers, being cute, friendly animals that dig up pretty plants to use, are meant to appeal to the pet-loving and building parts of the community. Since they suggest things about Minecraft's prehistoric past, and indeed come from it, they also have lore implications.

These aesthetic features are equally as important (and useful) as practical features.

-

All that said, I do like these ideas, but I think what I said should be kept in mind. Sniffers aren't useless, their use might not be something you in particular are interested in, but they're useful to other people.

I'd rather have 1-3 armor trims whenever they occur in chest loot.
I've thought if they could be 1 diamond + 7 of the appropriate material to the trim (or 1 slab version of the material, since the trims seem like slabs rather than full block sized).
clay that then needs to be baked. It would change the "saving diamonds" to "saving time..."

Agreed. I'd have already ventured across my world and fought to find a template that is only cosmetic and 7 diamonds more for adding color is a bit much. 7 diamonds to apply netherite to diamond equipment is acceptable though.
Cheaper trims would also make it more practical to apply them to lower tier armor, as you wouldn't have to spend the equivalent of Diamond Leggings for each piece you want to decorate.

Armor trims are a purely cosmetic item. It feels like a huge waste to use diamonds (an item that can be very useful when used for something else) on something that is essentially â€œuselessâ€ and is only there for the fun of having it. Also, I think that the audience who wants armor trims, does not overlap very much with the audience that has a lot of expensive items like diamonds, as those players would probably use them on something more useful.

Challenge advancement: "Armoured Box of Bones!" - get hit by a Flood while wearing full netherite armour.
This idea is very good as there are few unique mobs that appear in the cave.

Believe it or not, this could actually fit a storytelling update, especially if we consider the horror genre. Flood could surround the deepslate layer & make traversal more difficult than it was before, which is good given that some could still easily achieve a couple diamonds without the fear of being eaten alive by zombies, as is the usefulness of the iron sword.

 

Although I'd avoid calling it the flood, since a certain space game already does that... I'd preferably call it a "legion".
I'm also rooting for new cave specific mobs!
